decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana sources like Grim Monolith and Thran Dynamo to quickly ramp into big Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Emrakul. Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void are used to disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like City of Traitors and Cloudpost generate large amounts of mana to power out threats. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient ramping and powerful threats, utilizing cards like All Is Dust and Ugin to clear the board and seal the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers and creature cards to control the board and generate card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse color requirements of the spells in the deck. Overall, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's actions, outvalue them in card advantage, and eventually win through incremental advantage and superior board position.

This control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a mix of countermagic, hand disruption, and removal spells while utilizing powerful card draw and planeswalkers to maintain card advantage and control the game. With a strong mana base and a mix of versatile threats and answers, this deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent in order to secure a victory through attrition and manipulation of resources.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans with counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It also aims to generate card advantage through powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Baleful Strix to apply pressure while providing additional utility. With a strong mana base and versatile spells, this control deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponents in the Legacy format.

This Legacy control Stoneblade deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Leovold, Emissary of Trest alongside equipment like Batterskull, Sword of Fire and Ice, and Umezawa's Jitte. The deck utilizes disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to control the board while also having removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay. The deck also includes mana acceleration with Noble Hierarch and Deathrite Shaman, providing a versatile and disruptive game plan against opponents.

This deck focuses on assembling a key combo involving cards like Goblin Charbelcher, Lion's Eye Diamond, Lotus Petal, and rituals to generate mana and cast spells quickly. It aims to rapidly build up mana, draw cards, and eventually play Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Burning Wish for additional toolbox options and ways to find key combo pieces. The goal is to win the game in a fast and explosive manner before the opponent can set up their own game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay to control the opponent's resources while also deploying early threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Deathrite Shaman to apply pressure. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Liliana of the Veil to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the deck's color requirements. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast clock to win the game.

The key idea of this deck is to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent, utilizing a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. By focusing on fast, direct damage with cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Price of Progress to punish opponents for playing non-basic lands, further increasing the pressure on the opponent to act quickly or risk losing.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of artifact creatures and disrupt their game plan with disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst. The key strategy is to use cards such as Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager to pump up the artifact creatures, while also utilizing cards like Walking Ballista to deal direct damage. The deck also includes a strong mana base with fast lands like City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb to power out its threats quickly.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly and efficiently as possible. By using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map, the goal is to find Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create the 20/20 Marit Lage token. To protect the combo, cards like Pithing Needle and Duress are included to disrupt opponents' plans. The deck also includes mana acceleration in the form of Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide to accelerate the combo and disrupt opponents through hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' game plans with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, while using efficient creatures like Mirran Crusader and Serra Avenger to pressure opponents. Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic provide additional flexibility and consistency, allowing the deck to maintain a strong tempo throughout the game. Key pieces like equipment cards and Karakas give the deck additional reach and resilience, making it a versatile and adaptable strategy capable of answering a wide range of threats.

The deck focuses on quickly locking down opponents with disruptive enchantments like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Hazoret the Fervent to close out the game quickly. With mana acceleration from Ancient Tomb and Chrome Mox, the deck aims to establish an early advantage and keep the opponent on the back foot with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Fiery Confluence. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides additional card advantage and removal options, making it difficult for opponents to mount a successful defense.

The main concept of this deck is to mill cards quickly and efficiently in order to fill your graveyard with creatures that can be reanimated or sacrificed for various effects. The key strategy is to use cards like Careful Study, Cabal Therapy, and Breakthrough to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures like Stinkweed Imp, Ichorid, and Narcomoeba. Once your graveyard is filled, you can use cards like Dread Return and Flame-Kin Zealot to reanimate creatures and generate powerful synergies. This deck relies on graveyard recursion and fast-paced gameplay to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

This deck revolves around creating a powerful board presence using Elves and combo pieces such as Glimpse of Nature and Natural Order to generate large amounts of mana and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with a sudden and explosive finish, often brought about by playing Craterhoof Behemoth and utilizing its ability to give all creatures a massive power boost. The deck relies on efficient mana production and card draw to quickly assemble its combo pieces and outpace opponents before they can mount a defense.

This Grixis Aggro deck is focused on quickly deploying threats such as Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also runs efficient removal in Lightning Bolt and disruption with Wasteland. The goal of the deck is to maintain aggressive pressure while keeping the opponent on the back foot with tempo plays like Daze and Brainstorm. Deathrite Shaman provides additional utility and can further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain aggressive pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with efficient removal spells and counterspells. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis, while using cards like Deathrite Shaman and Gurmag Angler to apply constant pressure. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's plays with cards like Wasteland and Daze, while maintaining card advantage and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. Overall, the deck focuses on a fast and aggressive game plan with disruptive elements to control the game.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain tempo and pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, Gurmag Angler, and Deathrite Shaman. Using disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, Spell Pierce, and Lightning Bolt, along with card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to control the board while quickly closing out the game. Additionally, the deck includes a mana denial strategy with Wasteland and a versatile removal option with Forked Bolt.

The essence of this Grixis Aggro deck lies in its reliance on disruptive spells like Stifle, Force of Will, and Daze to control the opponent's plays, while also using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler to pressure the opponent?s life total. The deck?s mana denial strategy, with cards like Wasteland and Stifle, paired with its ability to quickly deploy threats and protect them, allows for a fast and aggressive game plan.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting their game plan with cards like Wasteland, Daze, Spell Pierce, and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the pace of the game with cheap, interactive spells like Lightning Bolt and Brainstorm, while also utilizing Deathrite Shaman for additional utility and reach. The deck also uses cantrips like Ponder and Gitaxian Probe to ensure consistent draws and maintain card advantage.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on controlling the board through cheap spells and disruption while quickly building up a threatening board presence with creatures like Young Pyromancer and Delver of Secrets. The inclusion of cards like Cabal Therapy and Gitaxian Probe helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also providing valuable information. The deck also has access to a variety of efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland to deal with threats. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes versatile cards such as Gitaxian Probe and Cabal Therapy to control the opponent's hand. In addition, the deck includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt to finish off the opponent or deal with problematic creatures. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and dual lands for consistency.

The main concept of this Legacy Combo - Infect deck is to use fast mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Glistener Elf to pump up evasive infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Inkmoth Nexus with cards like Invigorate and Berserk, dealing lethal poison damage to the opponent in just a few turns. The deck also includes protection with counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as card draw and manipulation to find the necessary combo pieces quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on using lands to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful token creatures, while also using Wasteland and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Life from the Loam allows for card advantage and recurring lands, while Punishing Fire provides removal and a win condition. Crop Rotation and Gamble provide flexibility in finding key lands or cards. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through land-based control tactics.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up a combo win condition with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. The deck also includes various utility lands to further control the board and provide card advantage. Additionally, cards like Punishing Fire and Molten Vortex provide removal and damage potential. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently managing lands to gain an advantage and eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful combos and control elements.

The core theme of this deck revolves around utilizing cards like Counterbalance, Soothsaying, and Predict to manipulate the top of the library, allowing for control over the opponent's plays. Utilizing cards like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus for removal, alongside powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of counterspells, card draw, and powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Monastery Mentor, this deck thrives on disruption, card advantage, and strategic planning to outmaneuver opponents.

The deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to stabilize the game with powerful board wipes like Terminus and Supreme Verdict, while maintaining card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta. The deck can also win by generating a powerful army of angels with Entreat the Angels. Overall, the strategy revolves around control, resource management, and outlasting the opponent in a slow and methodical manner.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, manipulating the top of the library with cards like Predict and Portent, and efficiently removing threats with cards like Terminus and Supreme Verdict. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to gain card advantage and control the board. The deck also includes a win condition with Entreat the Angels. The mana base includes fetch lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent in a long game.

The deck aims to quickly get powerful creatures into the graveyard and then bring them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's key strategy is to cheat high-cost creatures like Griselbrand, Iona, and Grave Titan into play early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach. It also looks to generate card advantage with cards like Shardless Agent and Ancestral Vision. The deck aims to control the board with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil while utilizing the graveyard synergy provided by Deathrite Shaman. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and out-maneuver the opponent to secure a win through a combination of disruption and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cheat big, powerful creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand into play using the combo of Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with these huge threats and disrupt their plays with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. It also has ways to manipulate its draws with cantrips like Ponder and Preordain. The deck can win the game in just a few turns by getting its big creatures into play and attacking for massive damage.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using cards like Sneak Attack and Show and Tell. The deck also includes cards like Omniscience and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to provide additional card advantage and control elements. With a mix of card selection, countermagic, and fast mana acceleration, this combo-centric deck aims to overwhelm opponents with giant creatures and game-ending plays in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and fast mana sources to cast multiple spells in a single turn, building up to a critical mass to either combo off with Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony for a lethal storm count, or to flashback spells with Past in Flames for a final push. It also includes discard spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's hand and protect the combo. The deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively through the storm mechanic.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of fast mana spells like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, along with ritual spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The deck aims to cast spells like Ad Nauseam and Infernal Tutor to find key combo pieces like Tendrils of Agony to win the game. The deck also features card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to help dig for combo pieces, as well as disruption spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo.
